title: Willie Swann
text:
Willie Swann (born 1974) is a New Zealand former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer and coach of <a href="Samoans">Samoan</a> heritage. He currently coaches the <a href="Auckland%20Vulcans">Auckland Vulcans</a> in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a>. He is a former <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> international and vice-captain. He also played for the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a>, <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> and the <a href="Auckland%20Warriors">Auckland Warriors</a>.
Playing career.
Swann was a <a href="Marist%20Saints">Marist Saints</a> junior who played fifteen matches for the <a href="Waitakere%20City%20Raiders">Waitakere City Raiders</a> in the 1994 <a href="Lion%20Red%20Cup">Lion Red Cup</a>, scoring 29 points. He was a <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwi</a> in 1993. He played for the <a href="Auckland%20Warriors">Auckland Warriors</a> Colts in 1995.
He was an <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">Auckland Warrior</a> 1995-1996 where he played a crucial role in laying a platform for the reserve grade to reach the 1996 grand final.
For <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a>, he played in both the <a href="1995%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1995</a> and <a href="2000%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2000 World Cups</a> scoring 5 points.
Later years.
In 2006 and 2007 Swann worked as a supply and rugby teacher in <a href="Great%20Sankey%20High%20School">Great Sankey High School</a>, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>, England. He coached the G.S.H.S Year 10 (2006–07), rugby league team to both the North West and National finals, narrowly losing 19–18 in Uxbridge.
Between 2009 and 2010 he was the head coach of the <a href="East%20Coast%20Bays%20Barracudas">East Coast Bays Barracudas</a> alongside <a href="Joe%20Vagana">Joe Vagana</a>. He was an old boy at <a href="Liston%20College">Liston College</a>, and is now a teacher and dean there.
In 2012, he was appointed the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> new Development coach. He was originally appointed the Warriors <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">Toyota Cup</a> assistant coach for the 2013 season before taking a role as the <a href="Auckland%20Vulcans">Auckland Vulcans</a> <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a> head coach. He was an assistant NSW Cup coach for the Warriors in 2015 and in 2016 he coached the <a href="Mount%20Albert%20Lions">Mount Albert Lions</a>.
On 28 September 2016 he was announced as an assistant coach to the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand national rugby league team</a>.
Personal life.
His brother, <a href="Anthony%20Swann">Anthony Swann</a>, and cousin, <a href="Logan%20Swann">Logan Swann</a>, both also played rugby league professionally.
